thread.title: Jenks will run at Cal-Berkeley

title: Jenks will run at Cal-Berkeley
text:
Jenks will run at Cal-Berkeley Jenks will run at Cal-Berkeley Linn-Mar distance ace has 8 state titles in track, 1 in cross country Gazette , Iowa Prep Sports , Prep Sports , Prep Track and Field , Preps Etc. By Jeff Linder , Sports , Sports Rotator , Photos Linn-Mar’s Stephanie Jenks (right) congratulated West Des Moines Dowling’s Hannah Thomas after winning the Class 4A 1,500-meter run at the state track meet last May. An eight-time state champion, Jenks said on social media Thursday that she will attend the University of California at Berkeley. (Jim Slosiarek/The Gazette) Iowa Football Data Center

SOMERSAULTS GYMNASTS SHINE AT 2 EVENTS 
Laura Swart of the Somersau Jeff Linder , The Gazette October 22, 2015 | 10:04 pm 
MARION — Linn-Mar distance ace Stephanie Jenks said on social media Thursday that she will attend the University of California at Berkeley. 
“I’m excited to announce I will continue my running career at the University of California at Berkeley! #gobears,” she said on Twitter. 
Jenks could not be reached for comment and did not answer a telephone call Thursday night. 
Linn-Mar girls’ track coach Nathan Hopp said, “I thought she would go somewhere out west. It’s a great school. She’s very academically focused. It will be a very good fit for her.” 
Jenks is an eight-time state champion in track and field. She owns the all-time Iowa best in the 1,500- and 3,000-meter races. 
At the state meet last May, Jenks captured the 800, 1,500 and 3,000 meters and was fifth in the 400-meter hurdles. 
She has won the 1,500 and 3,000 three times each and is a two-time champion in the 800. 
Jenks won the Class 4A state cross country title as a freshman, but has not run cross country since. She swam at Linn-Mar through her first three seasons of high school.
